subject: Philosophy
title: Character Over Actions
description: A micro-lesson that makes Character Over Actions usable.

hook.text: Utilitarianism asks 'what should I do?' Virtue ethics asks 'what kind of person should I be?'

buildup.text: The focus shifts from individual acts to character. A honest person makes honest choices naturally.

discovery.text: Aristotle believed good character develops through habit. Do courageous things and courage grows.

twist.text: Critics ask: what about situations where a good person does something terrible? Character isn't enough.

climax.text: Virtue ethicists reply: no system is perfect. But building character prepares you for what rules can't cover.

punchline.text: Be the right person and the right acts follow.

quiz.question: What does virtue ethics focus on, unlike utilitarianism?
options: Who you are, not just what you do
